intro: Orchis ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with three sepals and three petals, one of which is often modified into a lip. Orchis ambigua is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often associated with calcareous habitats.
